plant_concentrations.Value: Isopsoralen has been isolated and detected in various Umbelliferae, including angelica (Angelica atropurpurea), parsnip (Pastinaca sativa) and several hogweed (Heracleum) species(1). Isopsoralen has been detected in the fresh fruiting heads of Heracleum mantegazzianum at 292 mg/100g; Isopsoralen has been detected at 0.5 mg/g in the root of H. sphondylium; concentrations in roots of H. laciniatum were circa 0.05 mg/g of root for isopsoralen(1). Isopsoralen is a main active component of Psoralea corylifolia, a traditional Chinese medicine(2,3).
